Description: Fragment of concave lip (mended from two fragments) of Attic pottery type C cup; wholly glazed save for top of rim and slightest area outside at lower break; incised inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: A reserved top of rim is rare in Black Glaze, therefore it is likely that the sherd belongs to a red-figured vase.

Cups type C are attested before 510BC in destruction levels at Sybaris, see E. Greco, 'Sullo σχῆμα di Thurii: venti anni di ricerche con Silvana Luppino', Annuario della Scuola archeologica di Atene e delle Missioni italiane in Oriente XCII (Serie III, 14) (2014) [2016], 1-11, esp. 5.
Bibliographic references: Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 716, no. 744)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0663) (Phase 1)
